newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Australian govt to talk on meat inspection in U.S.
newsitem.headline: Australian govt to talk on meat inspection in U.S.

text.p: Australian Primary Industries Minister John Anderson said on Monday he would push for the United States to accept Australia's proposed trial of a quality meat inspection system.
Anderson said in a statement he would meet U.S. Secretary of Agriculture Dan Glickman and other key government members in Washington from July 14 to 17.

"While meat inspection and quality assurance is the major issue for talks in Washington, I will also be raising other key portfolio issues relating to U.S. export subsidies and the impact of European Union exports of wheat gluten," he said.
Issues of agricultural policy and international climate change would also be on his agenda, he said.
